title: Researchers identify mutations that can lead to resistance to some chemotherapies
snippets: Investigators discovered that mutations in VPS35, a crucial component in a pathway that uses reactive oxygen species (ROS) to eliminate cancer cells, can lead to resistance against chemotherapies. This finding could aid in identifying tumors that are resistant to treatments.
summary: Investigators found that mutations in VPS35, a key part of a pathway utilizing reactive oxygen species (ROS) to destroy cancer cells, may cause resistance to chemotherapy. This discovery could help identify tumors that are resistant to treatment.
